DOC.detailed_description: The purpose study determine whether vary frequency length activity break workday differentially impact sedentary behavior health outcome . Women age 25-50 work full-time sedentary job participate less 60 minute overall physical activity per week recruit . At begin study participant visit laboratory complete baseline health assessment meet research assistant outline plan reduce sit time work . At time randomly assign one two group : 1 ) Group A ask take two 15-minute walk workday , 2 ) Group B ask stand move around 1-2 minute every half hour throughout workday . The total duration program eight week . During time participant ask keep brief daily log activity break workday . At end 8-week program participant return laboratory repeat health assessment . ASSESSMENTS : All participant complete follow test procedure : - Metabolic blood panel . Blood drawn quick finger stick ass total cholesterol , triglyceride , LDL , HDL , fast glucose . - DEXA scan . Participants lie body scanner 10 minute assess body composition . - Body measurement . A trained research assistant measure height , weight , waist circumference . - Blood pressure . A trained research assistant measure blood pressure use automate blood pressure cuff . In addition , participant complete follow assessment outside laboratory : - Questionnaires : Participants ask complete series questionnaire . This take 15-20 minute . - Accelerometer : Participants ask wear motion sensor total 21 day ( three 7-day period ) . This small apparatus wear around waist day . Participants complete log indicate wear accelerometer day . - Food diary : Participants ask record food intake total 9 day ( three 3-day period ) .
